english: set down. deposit people, allow a passenger to get down or out. The bus stopped to set down an old lady..
spanish: El autobus se detuvo para dejar bajar a una señora mayor.

english: set in. begin. When the fall (autumn) sets in, leaves turn reddish.
spanish: Cuando comienza el otoño, las hojas se vuelven rojizas.

english: set off. start on a journey, leave. What time did they set off?
spanish: ¿A qué hora se fueron (de viaje)?

english: set off. start a chain of events. The unpopular law set off a series of protests.
spanish: La impopular ley desencadenó una serie de protestas.

english: set off. start someone doing something. The comedian set everyone off laughing.
spanish: El comediante empezó haciendo reir a todos.

english: set off. contrast with, embellish. The pink wall helps to set off those green curtains.
spanish: La pared rosada ayuda a destacar esas cortinas verdes.

english: set off. explode. Who set the firework off?
spanish: ¿Quién hizo estallar los fuegos de artificio?

english: set on. order to attack. We will set our dogs on any intruders.
spanish: Prepararemos a nuestros perros para atacar a cualquier intruso.

english: set out. start on a journey. We set out at daybreak yesterday.
spanish: Partimos al alba ayer.

english: set up. place in position, erect. They have set up a statue to Lennon in the park.
spanish: Han colocado un monumento a Lennon en el parque.

english: set up. establish. He set up a special group of soldiers to guard him.
spanish: Estableció un grupo especial de soldados para protegerlo.

english: settle down. become contented in a new job or place. The family soon settled down in India..
spanish: La familia se adaptó pronto a la India.

english: settle for. reluctantly accept. Since there were no strawberries, we had to settle for grapes.
spanish: Visto que no había fresas nos tuvimos que contentar con uvas.

english: settle in. move in and become used to. We will come to visit you after you have both settled in.
spanish: Iremos a visitarlos después que se hayan adaptado.

english: settle up. pay one's debts to. Mario won the lottery and was able to settle up all his debts.
spanish: Mario ganó la lotería y pudo pagar todas sus deuda.

english: shake out. remove dust or dirt by shaking. She picked up the blanket and shook the dust out.
spanish: Levantó la frazada y le sacudió el polvo.

english: shout down. stop from speaking by shouting. The crowd shouted the speaker down.
spanish: La multitud gritó para que no se escuchara al orador.

english: show off. display. The hostess showed off her china dishes to the guests.
spanish: La anfitriona mostró su vajilla de porcelana a los invitados.

english: show off. act ostentatiously. Don't show off so much. Try to be modest.
spanish: No te mandes la parte. Trata de ser modesto.

english: show up. arrive. I waited for him till noon and he showed up at 3 pm.
spanish: Lo esperé hasta el mediodía y apareció a las tres de la tarde.

english: shrug off. dismiss as unimportant. They attempted to shrug off their mistake.
spanish: Intentaron hacer pasar desapercibido su error.

english: shut up. stop talking (slang). Shut up and listen to your father, Paul's mother said.
spanish: Cállate y escucha a tu padre, dijo la madre de Paul.

english: side with. support in a dispute. That was unfair. Why did you side with him?
spanish: Eso no estuvo bien. ¿Por qué te pusiste de su lado?

english: single out. select from others. You have been singled out for a vacation in Barcelona.
spanish: Ha sido seleccionado para unas vacaciones en Barcelona.

english: sit out. sit and endure. I had to sit out (sit through) the lecture without falling asleep.
spanish: Tuve que soportar sentado la conferencia sin dormirme.

english: sit up. not go to bed. I sat up all night waiting for you to come back.
spanish: Pasé en vela toda la noche esperando que regresaras.

english: size up. assess. I quickly sized up his financial situation.
spanish: Rápidamente estimé (calculé) su situación financiera.

english: sleep in. sleep later than usual. I'm sorry I'm late. I slept in.
spanish: Siento llegar tarde. Dormí más de lo acostumbrado.

english: sleep on. continue sleeping. She slept on after the phone had rung.
spanish: Ella continuó durmiendo después que sonó el teléfono.

english: slice up. cut into slices. The baker sliced up the loaf.
spanish: El panadero cortó en rebanadas el pan.

english: slip away. go or move quietly or quickly. The party was so boring that Mirtha and I slipped away when nobody was watching.
spanish: La fiesta fue tan aburrida que Mirta y yo nos escabullimos cuando nadie miraba.

english: slow down. reduce speed, go more slowly (separable when transitive). The driver slowed down at the roundabout.
spanish: El conductor redujo la velocidad en la rotonda.

english: smooth over. improve, get rid of difficulties, problems. We all tried to smooth over the difficult situation.
spanish: Todos intentamos mejorar la difícil situación.

english: soak up. absorb. The big sponge soaked up all the water on the floor.
spanish: La esponja grande absorbió todo el agua del piso.

english: sort out. organize, arrange or order by classes or categories. It will take some time to sort out this mess.
spanish: Llevará cierto tiempo poner en orden este lío.

english: sound out. try to learn someone's opinions and intentions. We attempted to sound him out.
spanish: Intentamos tantearlo para conocer su opinión.

english: speak out. speak loudly, clearly. Speak up!! We cannot hear you at the back of the room.
spanish: ¡¡Hable más fuerte!! No le escuchamos en el fondo de la sala.

english: speed up. increase speed, accelerate, move faster. He speeded up when he saw that he was being followed.
spanish: Aceleró cuando vio que lo perseguían.

english: spell out. say or write each letter of a word. Will you please spell your last name out?
spanish: ¿Puede deletrear su apellido?

english: spit it out. speak louder, tell everything (slang). Spit it out and let us know the truth.
spanish: Dilo de una vez y cuéntanos la verdad.

english: split up. divide. OM Personal megaportal is split up into over 100 bilingual courses and tutorials.
spanish: El megaportal de OM Personal está dividido en más de 100 cursos y tutoriales bilingües.

english: spy out. discover by spying. He spied out the land and decided it was safe to proceed.
spanish: Espió el terreno y decidió que era seguro para avanzar.

english: stammer out. stammer, speak not fluently. They stammered out their apologies.
spanish: Tartamudearon al disculparse. (Se disculparon tartamudeando).

english: stand by. support, be ready to help or to act. I hope you will stand by me in case I need your help.
spanish: Espero que me apoyes en caso de necesitar tu ayuda.

english: stand down. resign from an important position, retire. The President voluntarily stood down in favor of the new candidate.
spanish: El Presidente renunció voluntariamente en favor del nuevo candidato.

english: stand for. represent. What does OM stand for? O stands for Orlando and M stands for Moure, the first and last names of this megaportal's owner.
spanish: ¿Qué significa OM? O significa Orlando y M representa Moure, el nombre y apellido del dueño de este megaportal.

english: stand in for (someone). to substitute for someone; to do someone’s job for them when they are not there:. Your teacher is sick today, so I’m standing in for her.
spanish: Vuestra maestra está enferma hoy, por ello la estoy reemplazando.

english: stand out. be prominent. Lucila is really smart and she always stands out in class..
spanish: Lucila es realmente lista y siempre se destaca en clase.

english: stand up. rise to one's feet. We all stood up when the ladies came into the club.
spanish: Todos nos pusimos de pie cuando las damas entraron al club.

english: stand up for. support. My boss criticized Eliana and nobody stood up for her.
spanish: Mi jefe criticó a Eliana y nadie salió a defenderla.

english: stand up to. face bravely (with people). She will have to be brave and stand up to that situation.
spanish: Tendrá que ser fuerte y hacer frente a la situación.

english: stand up to. withstand (with things). This car will stand up to all kinds of strains.
spanish: Este automóvil soportará todo tipo de esfuerzos.

english: stay in. remain at home. I'm staying in this evening. I have a lot of work to do.
spanish: Me voy a quedar en casa esta noche, Tengo mucho por hacer.

english: stay up. remain out of bed. Diana stayed up all night reading my book.
spanish: Diana se quedó levantada toda la noche leyendo mi libro.

english: step down. quit, resign, give up or retire from a position. Mr. Ronson stepped down for health reasons.
spanish: El Sr. Ronson se retiró (renunció) por razones de salud.

english: step in. intervene. The government had to step in to save the business.
spanish: El gobierno tuvo que intervenir para salvar el negocio.

english: stick out for. insist on (colloquial). The men stuck out for better conditions of employment.
spanish: Los hombres insistieron en mejores condiciones laborales.

english: stick to. adhere to. The architect said that he would stick to the original plan.
spanish: El arquitecto dijo que se ajustaría al plano original.

english: stick up for. defend, support (colloquial). Will you stick up for me at the trial?
spanish: ¿Me defenderás (apoyarás) en el juicio?

english: stir up. mix, move around. She stirred up the jam with a wooden spoon.
spanish: Ella revolvió la mermelada con una cuchara de madera.

english: stock up on. lay in supplies. We should stock up on every sort of exotic fruits.
spanish: Deberíamos abastecernos de todo tipo de frutas exóticas.

english: strike off. cross out. Who struck my name off (out)?
spanish: ¿Quién tachó mi nombre?

english: stumble across. find accidentally. The explorers stumbled across an interesting fossil.
spanish: Los exploradores hallaron (descubrieron) un interesante fósil.

english: sum up. summarize. The director summed up the interview in a few words.
spanish: El director resumió la entrevista en unas pocas palabras.

english: summon up. gather together. She attempted to summon up her courage and spoke.
spanish: Ella trató de juntar (hacerse de) coraje y habló.

english: survive on. survive using. During last summer, they had to survive on vegetables.
spanish: Durante el verano pasado tuvieron que vivir comiendo fruta.

english: switch off. prevent electricity, etc. From flowing by turning a switch. Switch the lights off, please.
spanish: Apaga las luces , por favor.

english: switch on. allow electricity, etc. to flow by turning a switch. She switched on the ceiling fan.
spanish: Ella encendió el ventilador de techo.

english: take aback. surprise. We were taken aback by the news of his departure.
spanish: Nos quedamos sorprendidos con la noticia de su partida.

english: take after. resemble an ancestor. Paul takes after his grandfather.
spanish: Paul se parece a su abuelo.

english: take along. escort. I took my sister along to the party.
spanish: Acompañé a mi hermana a la fiesta.

english: take apart. dismantle, divide into its constituent pieces. If you have to repair this PC, you have to take it apart first.
spanish: Si quieres reparar esta PC tienes que desmontarla primero.

english: take away. remove. He has locked the room and taken the key away.
spanish: Ha cerrado la habitación y se llevó la llave.

english: take back. return. Take this book back. We don't need it now.
spanish: Devuelve este libro. No lo necesitamos..

english: take care of. be in charge of. Roger takes care his father's business these days.
spanish: Roger está a cargo de los negocios de su padre estos dias.

english: take down. take to a lower place. He went to the shelf and took down a book of poems.
spanish: Se dirigió al estante y bajó un libro de poemas.

english: take down. pull down, pull to pieces. Take down your model railway before tea.
spanish: Desarma tu tren de juguete antes del té.

english: take down. write down, make a note of. The reporters took down the speech.
spanish: Los reporteros tomaron nota del discurso.

english: take down. humble, lower the pride of someone. That fellow needs to be taken down.
spanish: A ese tipo hay que bajarle los humos.

english: take in. understand. She told me that my son had taken her explanation in.
spanish: Me dijo que mi hijo había comprendido su explicación.

english: take in. escort inside a house. He took me in and offered me a cup of coffee.
spanish: Me hizo pasar y me ofreció una taza de café.

english: take in. admit or receive as guests or lodgers. This woman takes in lodgers at home.
spanish: Esta mujer recibe huéspedes en su casa.

english: take in. deceive, cheat. I was completely taken in by Monica's disguise.
spanish: El disfraz de Mónica me engañó totalmente.

english: take in. make smaller. The tailor took in the suit at the waist.
spanish: El sastre achicó el traje en la cintura.

english: take in. subscribe to, buy regularly. I have just started to take in the OM Personal free newsletter.
spanish: Acabo de suscribirme al boletín gratuito de OM Personal.

english: take off. remove. Please take off your hat.
spanish: Por favor quítate el sombrero.

english: take off. deduct. He took fifteen dollars off because I am a good customer.
spanish: Me descontó quince dólares porque soy un buen cliente.

english: take off. mimic. He is excellent at taking off famous stars.
spanish: Es excelente imitando artistas famosos..

english: take off. leave the ground, rise into the air. Your flight is scheduled to take off at 3.00 pm.
spanish: Tu vuelo está programado para despegar a las 15:00 horas.

english: take on. undertake work or responsibilites. She was glad to take on the responsibility of looking after Marina's kids.
spanish: Estaba contenta de asumir la responsabilidad de cuidar los chicos de Marina.

english: take on. engage to work. Sunrise Ltd. took on twenty additional people for the construction of the new bridge.
spanish: Sunrise Ltd. tomó veinte personas adicionales para la construcción del nuevo puente.

english: take out. carry outside a house, a room or a building. OM Personal takes their CD parcels out and post them.
spanish: OM Personal sale a franquear los paquetes de sus CDs.

english: take out. escort outside. He took the dog out for two hours.
spanish: Sacó al perro por dos horas.

english: take out. remove, extract. How many teeth did the dentist take you out?
spanish: ¿Cuantos dientes te extrajo el dentista?

english: take out. obtain a legal right or a document. He took out a patent on his new invention.
spanish: Obtuvo una patente de su nueva invención.

english: take out. accompany out, invite out to a party, a restaurant, a dance. John took Patricia out to have dinner at Lola's last night.
spanish: Anoche John llevó a Patricia a cenar a Lola.

english: take over. assume control. The new manager will take over at the beginning of June.
spanish: El nuevo gerente asumirá el cargo a principios de junio.

english: take up. raise, pick up. Take the carpet up before you move the furniture.
spanish: Levanta la alfombra antes de mover los muebles.

english: take up. occupy space, one's time, one's energies. My job takes up most of my time.
spanish: Mi trabajo ocupa la mayor parte de mi tiempo.

english: take up. begin to follow a profession, a hobby, a sport, a way of life. The medical student decided to take up surgery.
spanish: El estudiante de medicina decidió emprender cirugía.

english: take up. shorten. I need to take this dress up at the bottom.
spanish: Necesito acortar el ruedo de este vestido.

english: take up. arrest. He was taken up by the police for drunkenness.
spanish: La policía lo arrestó por borrachera.

english: take up on. accept an offer. I need a car so I would like to take you up on your offer.
spanish: Necesito un auto de modo que me gustaría aceptar tu oferta.

english: take up with. become friendly with. Molly took up with Robert after he had saved her life in Miami.
spanish: Molly se hizo amiga de Robert después que él le había salvado la vida en Miami.

english: talk away. continue talking incessantly. She talked away for over two hours and told me all her troubles.
spanish: Habló sin parar durante más de dos horas y me contó todos sus problemas.

english: talk back to. argue rudely with. Don't talk back to your father: listen to what he says.
spanish: No contestes mal a tu padre: escucha lo que dice.

english: talk down. silence a person by talking. I tried to argue with her, but she talked me down.
spanish: Traté de discutir con ella pero no me dejó hablar.

english: talk down to. speak patronizingly. He always talks down to people younger than he is.
spanish: Siempre trata como tontos a la personas más jóvenes que él.

english: talk down to. talk in a disdainful way to. She is unpopular because she often talks down to people.
spanish: No es apreciada porque a menudo haba mal de la gente.

english: talk into. persuade. Can you talk Mabel into changing her strict point of view?
spanish: ¿No puedes persuadir a Mabel para que cambie su estricto punto de vista?

english: talk out of. dissuade from. We tried to talk him out of quitting jis job.
spanish: Tratamos de disuadirlo de renunciar a su trabajo.

english: talk over. discuss. Let us talk it over before we decide.
spanish: Conversémoslo (Discutámoslo) antes de decidir.

english: talk round. persuade someone by talking (usually separated). Did you manage to talk your father round into lending us some money for the apartment?.
spanish: ¿Lograste persuadir a tu padre para que nos preste algo de dinero para el departamento?

english: tamper with. interfere with. Someone has tampered with the lock.
spanish: Alguien ha alterado (modificado) la cerradura.

english: tear off. separate or remove by tearing. He tore the paper off and opened his Christmas gift.
spanish: Arrancó el papel y abrió su regalo de Navidad.

english: tear out. pull out or remove by tearing. Neil tore a page out and gave it to me.
spanish: Neil arrancó una página y me la entregó.

english: tear up. destroy by tearing, tear into pieces. She tore up her husband's letter.
spanish: Hizo pedazos la carta de su marido.

english: tell off. reprove, scold. Betty's boss told her off for being late.
spanish: El jefe de Betty la reprendió por llegar tarde.

english: think out. consider. I need some time to think your proposal out (over).
spanish: Necesito algo de tiempo para analizar tu propuesta.

english: think up. invent. What will they think up next?
spanish: ¿Qué inventarán la próxima vez?

english: throw away. get rid of. I must throw all this rubbish away (out).
spanish: Tengo que tirar toda esta basura.

english: throw over. abandon. He threw over his old frineds when when his father died.
spanish: Abandonó a sus viejos amigos cuando murió su padre.

english: throw up. raise. They threw up their hands in utter amazement.
spanish: Levantaron las manos totalmente sorprendidos.

english: throw up. resign, quit. She threw up her job because of her failing health.
spanish: Renunció a su trabajo debido a su debilitada salud.

english: throw up. vomit. He ate too much and threw up at night.
spanish: Comió en exceso y vomitó de noche.

english: throw up. reject, abandon. He threw up his previous plan of going to Paris for his vacation.
spanish: Abandonó su plan inicial de ir a París de vacaciones.

english: thrust on. force upon. They thrust the responsibility upon the manager.
spanish: Obligaron al gerente a aceptar su responsabilidad..

english: tick off. mark with a tick. She ticked off all the things she had packed up.
spanish: Ella tildó (marcó) todas las cosas que había empacado.

english: tidy up. put in order. You must tidy up your room before the visitor arrives.
spanish: Tienes que ordenar la habitación antes que llegue el visitante.

english: tie up. bind up. The thief tied up his victim.
spanish: El ladrón ató a su víctima.

english: tie up. be busy, not free (usually in the passive). I cannot see you tonight as I will be tied up all evening.
spanish: No puedo verte esta noche porque estaré tapado (lleno de trabajo) toda la tarde.

english: tire out. completely exhaust. The long journey tired us all out.
spanish: El largo viaje nos dejó exhaustos a todos.

english: total up. add up in number and quantity. The cashier totalled up the value of both cheques.
spanish: El cajero totalizó (sumó) el valor de ambos cheques.

english: touch down. land (of planes). The plane touched down at 9 am.
spanish: El avión bajó (aterrizó) a las 9 de la mañana.

english: touch on. mention. She touched on many important subjects in class.
spanish: Ella tocó (mencionó) muchos temas importantes en clase.

english: track down. capture by tracking, search for and find. The detective finally tracked him down at the library.
spanish: El detective finalmente lo localizó en la biblioteca.

english: trade in. give as part payment. Why don't you trade in your old car for a new one?
spanish: ¿Por qué no canjeas tu viejo auto por uno nuevo?

english: triffle away. waste time, money, opportunities. Don't triffle away your time on parties and dances.
spanish: No desperdicies el tiempo en fiestas y bailes.

english: trip up. cause to stumble. Walter put his foot out and stripped his sister up.
spanish: Walter estiró su pie e hizo tropezar a su hermana.

english: try on. test clothes by putting them on. Helen tried on the new dress, but it didn't fit her.
spanish: Helen se probó el vestido nuevo pero no le iba bien.

english: try out. test by using. Let's try out this new computer before buying it.
spanish: Probemos esta computadora antes de comprarla.

english: tune in. find a station on the radio (separable when transitive). We tuned in to listen to the B.B.C. program.
spanish: Sintonizamos la radio para escuchar el programa de la B.B.C.

english: turn away. turn or look in a different direction. She turned away because the sight of the accident was too much for her to bear.
spanish: Ella se dio vuelta (apartó la vista) porque la visión del accidente era demasiado fuerte para que soportarlo.

english: turn away. 2) refuse admission, dismiss. The stadium was full so many people had to be turned away.
spanish: El estadio estaba lleno y a mucha gente se le rechazó el ingreso.

english: turn back. turn in a reverse or contrary direction (separable when transitive). We decided to turn back when we saw all the cows in the middle of the road.
spanish: Decidimos dar vuelta (regresar) cuando vimos todas las vacas en el medio de la carretera.

english: turn down. put down, fold over. He turned down the collar of his coat.
spanish: Bajó el cuello de su abrigo..

english: turn down. 2) reduce or make lower by turning (a switch, a faucet). She turned the radio down when the telephone rang.
spanish: Redujo el volumen de la radio cuando sonó el teléfono.

english: turn in. go to bed (colloquial). We decided to turn in early after our long journey.
spanish: Decidimos ir a la cama temprano luego de nuestro largo viaje.

english: turn inside out. reverse (usually separated). He turned all his pockets inside out but he couldn't find his key.
spanish: Dio vuelta todos los bolsillos pero no pudo encontrar su llave.

english: turn into. change into. Our sofa can be turned into a double bed.
spanish: Nuestro sillón puede ser convertido en una cama doble.

english: turn off. prevent water, electric current from flowing by using a switch. Turn the lights off before you go to bed.
spanish: Apaga las luces antes de irte a la cama.

english: turn on. allow water, electric current to flow by using a switch. She turned on the television and sat down.
spanish: Encendió el televisor y se sentó.

english: turn out. prove to be. Everything turned out all right in the end.
spanish: Todo resultó bien al final.

english: turn out. produce. The factory turns out twenty cars each day.
spanish: La fábrica produce veinte automóviles por día.

english: turn up. 2) raise or make higher by turning (a switch, a faucet). They turned the volume up and a neighbor knocked at the door.
spanish: Subieron el volumen y un vecino golpeó a la puerta.

english: turn upside down. disturbe, disarrange (usually separated). She turned the whole house upside down when she tried to find the missing key.
spanish: Ella dio vuelta la casa cuando trató de encontrar la llave que faltaba.

english: use up. exhaust the supply of, consume. We have used up all the printing paper. We need to buy more.
spanish: Hemos consumido todo el papel de impresión. Tenemos que comprar más.

english: usher into. lead, conduct. The maid ushered us into the modern living-room.
spanish: La mucama nos condujo hasta la moderna sala de estar.

english: verge on. approach. Her husband's behavior always verges on rudeness.
spanish: El comportamiento de su marido siempre raya en la grosería.

english: volunteer to. do a task. When I was younger I volunteered to teach English for free.
spanish: Cuando era más joven me ofrecí para enseñar inglés gratis.

english: wade through. slowly peruse. We had to wade through a pile of documents.
spanish: Tuvimos que recorrer lentamente una pila de documentos.

english: wait on. attend, assist, help. Two salesgirls are waiting on the customer.
spanish: Dos vendedoras están atendiendo al cliente.

english: wait up for. stay out of bed for. He waited up for the news of his daughter.
spanish: Aguardó despierto las noticias de su hija.

english: wake up. stop sleeping. He wakes up at six every day.
spanish: Se despierta a las seis todos los días.

english: walk about. stroll. Before our flight back we spent a pleasant hour walking about the Buenos Aires Botanical Garden.
spanish: Antes de nuestro vuelo de regreso pasamos una agradable hora paseando por el Jardín Botánico de Buenos Aires.

english: walk away with. win easily, steal, take away. They walked away with all the prizes.
spanish: Arrasaron con (Se robaron) todos los premios.

english: walk out on. leave, abandon. My sister is sad because her boyfriend walked out on her.
spanish: Mi hermana está apenada porque su novio la dejó.

english: walk out with. court. Jane is walking out with an old friend of hers.
spanish: Jane está saliendo con un viejo amigo suyo.

english: warm up. become or make warmer (separable when transitive). The small fire warmed up all the room..
spanish: El pequeño fuego calento toda la habitación.

english: warm up. become more animated. He warmed up when he saw his brother again.
spanish: Se reanimó cuando vio a su hermano nuevamente.

english: warn off. inform in advance of what may happen. The guard warned the intruder off not to enter.
spanish: El guardia le advirtió al intruso que no entrara.

english: wash down. clean a car, a ship by using a stream or jet of water. The crew spent two days washing the ship down.
spanish: La tripulación se pasó dos dias baldeando el barco.

english: wash off. remove a stain by washing. She was able to wash the dirty mark out.
spanish: Ella pudo eliminar la marca de suciedad.

english: wash up. clean dishes after a meal (separable when transitive). Who is washing up tonight?
spanish: ¿Quién va a lavar los platos esta noche?

english: watch out for. beware of, be careful with. If you go into the jungle, watch out for tigers and snakes.
spanish: Si entras en la selva ten cuidado con los tigres y las víboras.

english: watch out. beware, be careful. Watch out! The roads are icy today.
spanish: ¡Ten cuidado! Las carreteras están resbaladizas hoy.

english: watch over. guard. The shepherd watched over the sheep.
spanish: El pastor vigilaba las ovejas.

english: water down. dilute. This soup has been watered down.
spanish: Esta sopa se ha aguado.

english: wear away. gradually reduce the height by constant wearing. The soles of his shoes were worn away.
spanish: Las suelas de sus zapatos estaban desgastadas.

english: wear off. diminish, cease or disappear gradually. My toothache has now worn off.
spanish: Mi dolor de muelas ya ha desaparecido.

english: wear on. pass slowly on. The night wore on and still he could not sleep.
spanish: Transcurría la noche y aún así no se podía dormir.

english: wear out. gradually destroy by wearing or using. My jacket is wearing out, although it is only a year old.
spanish: Mi chaqueta se está gastando aunque apenas tiene un año.

english: wear out. exhaust (separable but usually used in the passive). I felt worn out after the long flight to Australia.
spanish: Me sentía agotado después del largo vuelo a Australia.

english: weed out. remove weeds or what is unwanted. The manager insisted that they had to weed out all the unsuitable candidates as they had to weed out their gardens.
spanish: El gerente insistió que tenían que eliminar los postulantes inadecuados como tenían que eliminar la maleza de sus jardines.

english: weigh out. estimate how heavy it is. The greengrocer weighed out a kilo of strawberries for Molly.
spanish: El verdulero calculó un kilo de fresas para Molly.

english: weigh up. consider carefully. He weighed up his chances of promotion before quitting..
spanish: El analizó sus oportunidades de ascenso antes de renunciar.

english: while away. spend some time pleasantly. We whiled away the whole afternoon at the exhibition.
spanish: Pasamos toda la tarde en la exposición.

english: win over. convert. This priest won over many people to Christianity.
spanish: Este sacerdote convirtió mucha gente al Cristianismo.

english: win through. survive, recover. Despite all the hardships, he won through.
spanish: Sobrevivió a pesar de todas las privaciones.

english: wind up. turn the spring of a machine or a clock to make it go. I forgot to wind up my cuckoo clock last night.
spanish: Anoche olvidé darle cuerda a mi reloj cucú.

english: wind up. end a meeting or speech (separable when transitive). The meeting will wind up with a few English songs.
spanish: La reunion finalizará con algunas canciones inglesas.

english: wipe out. destroy, annihilate. A town near Miami was wiped out by the tornado.
spanish: Un pueblo próximo a Miami fue aniquilada por el tornado.

english: wipe up. take up liquid by wiping usually with a mop. He rushed to wipe up the pool of coffee on the wooden floor.
spanish: Corrió a secar el charco de café sobre el piso de madera.

english: wither up. become dry, faded or dead. Some flowers soon wither up under the rays of the sun.
spanish: Algunas flores se marchitan pronto bajo los rayos del sol.

english: work in. introduce. The author worked in a few lines about his own life in Africa.
spanish: El autor introdujo algunas líneas sobre su vida en Africa.

english: work in with. fit in with. His ideas for a new factory did not work in with those of his employers and he was fired.
spanish: Sus ideas de una nueva planta no encajaron con las de sus empleadores y fue despedido.

english: work off. get rid of, get over. He worked off his depression by visiting Menem's properties.
spanish: Superó su depresión visitando las propiedades de Menem.

english: work out. plan, solve by careful study. Can you work this puzzle out?
spanish: ¿Puedes resolver este acertijo?

english: work out. exhaust by working. The old coal mine has already been worked out.
spanish: La antigua mina de carbón ya ha sido agotada.

english: work out. be calculated at. The restaurant bill worked out at 20 dollars each.
spanish: La cuenta del restaurante resultó a 20 dólares por persona.

english: work out. produce the desired result. Their plan did not work out and the robbers were caught.
spanish: Su plan no funcionó y los ladrones fueron capturados.

english: work up. excite, arouse. The dictator worked up the emotions of the crowd.
spanish: El dictador despertó las emociones de la multitud.

english: work up. study more thoroughly. She told us to work up 300 Phrasal Verbs for the exam.
spanish: Nos indicó que estudiáramos en detalle 300 Verbos Frasales para el examen.

english: work up to. progress gradually to. His novel works up to a thrilling climax.
spanish: Su novela avanza gradualmente hacia un final apasionante.

english: worm out. find out by devious means find our without scruples. Don't let worm out your secret so easily.
spanish: No permitas que te sonsaquen tu secreto con tanta facilidad.

english: wrap up. cover, put round, roll up. It was very cold so I wrapped myself up in a blanket.
spanish: Estaba muy frío de modo que me envolví en una manta.

english: wrap up. wind or fold as a covering. She wrapped up the gift in a beautiful silver paper.
spanish: Envolvió el regalo en un hermoso papel plateado.

english: wriggle out of. avoid. Amanda always tries to wriggle out of her responsibilities.
spanish: Amanda siempre trata de evitar sus responsabilidades.

english: wrinkle up. to get wrinkles in perplexity. He wrinkled up his face and admitted he was puzzled.
spanish: Frunció el ceño y aceptó estar esconcertado.

english: write down. make a note. I wrote down the instructions.
spanish: Tomé nota de las instrucciones.

english: write into. add to in writing. The terms were written into the lease.
spanish: Se agregaron por escrito las condiciones a la locación.

english: write off. cancel, regard as. They were forced to write off several irretrievable debts.
spanish: Nos vimos forzados a dar de baja varias deudas incobrables.

english: write oneself out. exhaust one's ideas in writing. The novelist appears to have written himself out because nothing new has emerged from his pen since 2000.
spanish: El novelista parece haber agotado sus ideas porque nada nuevo ha salido de su pluma desde el año 2000.

english: write out. write in full. The witness wrote out his account of the acident.
spanish: El testigo pasó en limpio su versión del accidente.

english: write up. compose in writing. I used my notes to write up the report.
spanish: Usé mis notas para redactar el informe.

english: yearn after. desire strongly. Helen yearned after the sight of the old, familiar house.
spanish: Helen añoraba ver la vieja casa familiar.

english: yearn for. have affection for;  feel tenderness for. Both brothers yearn for their native land in Spain.
spanish: Los dos hermanos añoran su tierra natal en España.
